intro: Aulonemia verrucosa, commonly known as the rough spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants commonly found in wet or moist environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, spike-like inflorescence and rough, hairy surfaces on its stems and leaves. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and streams. Aulonemia verrucosa plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
